article_text:
TOPEKA — Half of Kansans participating in a statewide survey released Friday expressed at least moderate concern flaws in the state’s economy could threaten their family in the upcoming year and two-thirds were on board with escalating taxes on large corporations and top wage earners.

Login Here to Read More...

article_metadata.author: Tim Carpenter Topeka Capital-Journal
